59 [Eustas.]
[lawe]SEint Eustas þe noble kny&yogh;t : of heþene lawe[MS. londe] was;
Ake are he i-cristned were : men cleopeden him placidas.
he was with Traian þe Aumperour : hext of alle is kni&yogh;hte,
Maister he was of al is ost : at eche bataile to fi&yogh;hte.
he wilnede to wite godes lawe : and of cristindom;
Ake no man þar-of him ne tei&yogh;hte : ne &yogh;eme þare-to ne nam:
¶ his heorte him &yogh;af þat is lawe nas nou&yogh;t : and þare-fore almes-dede
Ofte he dude for godes loue : þat he him scholde þe bet rede.
A wif he hadde and twei sones : þat swiþe &yogh;oungue were;
heo wilnede &yogh;eorne þat sum man : of god hire wolde lere.â€”
þis hei&yogh;e kni&yogh;htes wenden a day : on honteth mani on
with heore cheuenteyn placidas : to cachche hert and bocke and don.
¶ A-mong oþur game huy founden ane heort : swiþe fair best with-alle:
placidas him siwede a-non : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte maken him falle.
Fram is felawes he wende al one : þis best orn with gret pas,
And he siwede him fer in vncouþe stude : þat al weri he was.
þo huy comen opon a fair hul : þis best with-stod atþe laste.
þis kni&yogh;ht ne dorste ner him wiende : ake bi-heold him stikele and faste.
Bi-twene is hornes he i-sai&yogh;h : ane creiz schine bri&yogh;hte
with gret leome ase it were of sonne : þat vnneþe bi-holde he it mi&yogh;hte.
¶ "Placidas," seide þe heort : "&yogh;wy woltþou weorri with me?
I-cham god þat þou ne knowest nou&yogh;t : ichulle schewi me to þe.
þine almesse-dedes þat þou hast i-do : a-mountede me bi-fore;
þat þou ne canst nou&yogh;t, i-chulle þe teche : þat þi soule ne beo for-lore.
þov were a-boute to cachche me : ichulle þe cahche al-so."
"Louerd," seide placidas : "sei&yogh;e me &yogh;wat i schal do."
¶ "Bote go," seide ore louerd þo : "hom to þine wiue,
And nim hire and evwere twei sones : and lat eou cristni bliue.
þus time to-moruwe cum a&yogh;ein : and ich þe wolle wisse
hou þou schalt leden here þi lijf : to of-serui heouene blisse."
þo nuste he &yogh;ware þe heort bi-cam. : þis kni&yogh;ht in grete þou&yogh;te
wende hom and þonkede god : þat swuch tiþingue him brou&yogh;hte.
his wiue he tolde it priueliche. : "sire, merci," heo seide,
"To-ni&yogh;ht ore louerd cam al-so to me : and ri&yogh;ht so he gan me rede."
¶ Huy nomen heore twey sones with heom : and to a bischop huy wende
And lieten heom cristni alle foure : heore lif for-to amende;
þis kny&YOGH;th liet is name tuyrne : and liet him cleopie Eustas.
With oþure kni&yogh;htes he wende eft an hontez : þudere ase he er was.
þis holie best he sai&yogh;h þo eft-sone : aftur he wende al-so,
For-to he cam in-to a priue stude : ase he hadde er i-do.
þo criede he and fel a-doun a-kneo : "louerd," he seide, "þin ore,
Tel me hou i schal mi lif lede : to saui me þoru&yogh;h þi lore."
Ore [louerd] spac þo in þe heortes mouþe : "loke þat þou do after me!
For þov hast þene deuel ouer-come : he armeth him a&yogh;en þe:
þolie þou schalt wo and sor : ase Men schulle in bataylle;
&YOGH;if þou wolt þolie and a-&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;hte : of is wille he schal faille.
he schal þe, ase he dude Iob : mid alle wo þe fonde;
Seie me &yogh;if þou it þolie wolt : and faste a-&yogh;ein him stonde!"
¶ "Louerd," seide þis guode kni&yogh;ht : "&yogh;if me studefast-hede,
þat ich mouwe is fondingue þole : ase þou me wolt wisse and rede."
"Ope þi-sulue it is &yogh;if þou wolt beo : studefast," ore louerd seide;
"Ake &yogh;if þou wolt so, ichulle in þi care : boþe witie þe and lede."
Mid þusse worde ore louerd wende : he nuste &yogh;ware he bi-cam.
þis kni&yogh;ht in grete þou&yogh;hte of heorte : þene wey hamward nam;
his wiue he tolde al hou it was : and bad hire studefast be.
To is louerdes court, þe aumperoures : nolde he nonmore teo.
¶ þo comen þeoues and robbeden him : of al þat euere he hadde;
his Orf deide al-so to grounde : nou&yogh;ht o best a-liue he nadde;
his hinene deiden euerechoneâ€” : þare bi-lefde non a-liue
Bote he and [is] tweie &yogh;ongue sones : and is leoue wiue.
þo ne bi-lefde heom non more guod : þane heom hieng a-bouteâ€”

For schame þat huy beggares weren : heore hous huy liete stonde
And bi ni&yogh;hte stelen a-wei : to-ward an oþur londe,
¶ Eustas al-one and is wijf : and is sones twei&yogh;e;
So &yogh;ungue weren þis children two : þat he bar heom ofte bi wei&yogh;e.
Gret deol made þe Aumperour : þo he miste sire Eustas,
And liet him seche al-a-boute : ake men nusten &yogh;ware he was.
Toward Egypte huy passeden þe se : for huy mosten so don nede.
Þo huy þe se ipassede hadden : þe schipman axede is mede.
huy seiden þat huy noþing nadden : ake þat huy beggares were.
Þe schipman bi-heold þat guode wif : and þou&yogh;te him of faire chere;
¶ he seide, "ichulle for mi mede : þis wumman with me at-holde."
Þe kni&yogh;ht weop and criede &yogh;eorne : ake hit ne mih&yogh;te no-þing holde,
Þis schipman nam[MS. nan] him and is sones : and out of þe schipe heom þraste,
And liet heom wienden &yogh;wodere huy wolden : and heold[MS. beold] þis womman faste.
Þe kny&yogh;ht bi-heold after-ward : ake þo it non-oþur nas,
Sore he weop and wrong[MS. wrond] is honden : longue i-swowe he was.
"Leue sones," he seide, "&yogh;wat schulle &yogh;e nou? : &yogh;oungue &yogh;e beoth, help-les,
In vncouþe londe; ho schal ou wite : nouþe &yogh;e beoth moder-les?
¶ Mi-sulf ich couþe mine mete bi-swynke : ake inot &yogh;wat &yogh;e schulle do;
A feble norice ich am, alas! : i nas neuere i-tei&yogh;ht þer-to."

To a deop watur he cam : and no schip ne fond he þar:
he bar is o sone ouer þat watur : and þare a-doun him sette.[Here a fol. is wanting in the MS.; MS. Cott. Iul. D ix. continues;]
